intro: Amauropelta grayumii, commonly known as the gray's shield fern, is a species of fern native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are evergreen and can reach lengths of up to 30 centimeters. Amauropelta grayumii plays a role in forest ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
